channel.title: RuneScape Max Hit Calculator
channel.description:
Hey guys, Tim here, just finished my RuneScape Max Hit Calculator v0.1.
This program has taken me a little over 2 hours to make, mainly because converting the code from HTML to VB.NET was a bitch.
Features LOL, - Catch Exception to stop the program from crashing if you put characters in it, rather then numbers. - Two radio buttons, Old RS is, well, Old RS | New RS x 10 damage, is, you guessed it, x 10 damage LOL.
Well that's pretty much it, enjoy, credits are in the program.
[URL=http://img839.imageshack.us/i/rsmaxhit.png/][IMG]http://img839.imageshack.us/img839/7669/rsmaxhit.png[/img][/URL]
Download Link: [URL=http://uppit.com/ycumoqxwvp7l/RuneScape_Max_Hit_Calculator.exe]Uppit[/URL]

item.title: RuneScape Max Hit Calculator
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“TimmahPwnz, post:15, topic:372946”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=468969.msg3429724#msg3429724 date=1292218229]

[quote author=TimmahPwnz link=topic=468969.msg3429719#msg3429719 date=1292218058]

you guys are so fucking paranoid about viruses and shit…

Or use http://www.tip.it/runescape/?page=max_hit_calc.htm
No risk of malicious content, has more features, and you won’t need to install another program.
[/quote]fuck off.

Agreed.

And the reason I made this program is for people who might be going on a trip without internet or something, so they can still use a max hit calculator.
[/quote]I agree this probably isn’t a virus, but why would you even need a max hit calculator if you can’t access RuneScape? It’s not like you would even be able to access your strength bonus without having internet.

EDIT - You could also just save the web file to your computer and run it without internet as well.

We’ll maybe your stuffing around with your server, trying to find the best strength bonus possible, use your imagination.

Also, this program was basically for myself, you know, testing and expanding my knowledge, and I thought, SOME people might appreciate this, clearly I was wrong, why is it when a nobody releases something, there’s ALWAYS a “Virus” factor, without anyone actually verifying this, if you trust the program, sure why not give it a go, otherwise gtfo this topic, through my eyes, this makes a lot of sense.

  • Tim[/quote]I agree, people are rather sensitive to viruses here, and it’s with any executable. The reason being that many viruses and other malicious content have been posted here, and people are very scared of them. (mostly because a lot of us have RS accounts)

If you added the extra features that the tip.it one has, I would be a lot more inclined to use it. Make it a Firefox plug-in, I will kiss you.

As for testing your knowledge and getting better at programming in the language, post the code in the general programming section and ask for some constructive criticism.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape Max Hit Calculator
item.dc:creator: @TimmahPwnz TimmahPwnz
item.description:
@TimmahPwnz wrote:

For fuck sake >.>

Here I hope ALL of you are happy now…

Imports System.Math

Public Class Form1

    Dim str_lvl As Integer = 1
    Dim str_bonus As Integer = 0
    Dim str_mult As Integer = 1
    Dim pot_boost As Integer = 0
    Dim dmg_mult As Integer = 1
    Dim max_hit As Integer = 0
    Dim dharok_mod As Integer = 1
    Dim style As Integer = 3
    Dim Cumulative_str As Integer = ((str_lvl + pot_boost) * (str_mult) + style) * dharok_mod

    Dim first As Integer = 0
    Dim second As Integer = 0
    Dim third As Integer = 0
    Dim fourth As Integer = 0

    Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click

        Try

            str_lvl = TextBox1.Text
            str_bonus = TextBox2.Text
            Cumulative_str = ((str_lvl + pot_boost) * (str_mult) + style) * dharok_mod

            max_hit += ((13 + (Cumulative_str) + (str_bonus / 8) + ((Cumulative_str * str_bonus) / 64)) * dmg_mult)

            max_hit = Math.Floor(max_hit)

            first = max_hit
            second = Math.Floor(first / 2)
            third = Math.Ceiling(first / 4)
            fourth = third - 1

            If (RadioButton1.Checked = True) Then
                max_hit = max_hit / 10
            Else
                ' Do nothing.
            End If

            displayHit.Text = max_hit

            str_lvl = 1
            str_bonus = 0
            str_mult = 1
            pot_boost = 0
            dmg_mult = 1
            max_hit = 0
            dharok_mod = 1
            style = 3
            Cumulative_str = ((str_lvl + pot_boost) * (str_mult) + style) * dharok_mod
            first = 0
            second = 0
            third = 0
            fourth = 0

        Catch ex As InvalidCastException
            TextBox1.Text = "Use numbers only"
            TextBox2.Text = "Use numbers only"
        End Try
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button2_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button2.Click
        MsgBox("First of all, I would like to give 50% credits to 'Tip.It\RuneScape' for the base code." & vbNewLine & "I would like to give 49% credits to me, for the conversion of this code from HTML to VB.net, and for making the program." & vbNewLine & "I would like to give 1% credits to Microsoft, for making Microsoft Visual Basics 2010 Express." & vbNewLine & "Thank you for using this program (: I will be releasing more hopefully." & vbNewLine & " - TimmahPwnz", Title:="Credits")
    End Sub
End Class

Note: Some parts of this code are not in use, because there might be used in a later version.

Read full topic
